column2: nanak, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After the first spinal surgery in 2006 for severe scoliosis to insert screws, I was due to have the second surgery to insert the rods.  The night before the 2nd surgery, I developed a very high fever & was rushed to ICU.  Multiple cultures later showed I had severe sepsis from Klebsiella cultured from my central IV line.  Two days later I stopped breathing suddenly and ended up on a ventilator for 4 days.  I was given the Xigris over about 2 days and I guess it worked because I am alive today with no side effects from it.

column2: csummer, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In July 2002, I was hospitalized with an e coli infection of the urinary tract. Within 12 hours, my bp dropped, my kidneys were failing, etc. My doctor in conjunction with an infectious disease specialist determined that I qualified for the Xigris treatment. After 36 hours of treatment, I was out of ICU and left the hospital 5 days later. Needless to say, I would not be writing this 6 years later, if the treatment were not available. I have followed the other trials and while I cannot speak for anyone but myself, I am thankful that it was available for me.

column2: JAB, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In June of 2003, I was in a coma with very little chance of survival.  All my systems were shutting down.  The doctors told my wife and children that I may only live another 24-48 hours.  After administering Xigris, I began to recover and within two days I was removed from the respirator and on the way to recovery. I didn't realize how experimental this drug was at the time but, it saved my life.
